title: Come Honk Your Horn
description: While perusing the local car lot, Dave Crabtree discovers his mother's been reincarnated as a junkie old car, so he buys her and brings her home, much to the dismay of both his wife and eccentric car collector Captain Manzini.

title: The De-Fenders
description: When Dave learns that there are local vandals who are stripping cars, he spends a sleepless night going to ridiculous lengths ensure his mother's safety.

title: What Makes Auntie Freeze
description: Dave is forced to drive his mother to a mountaintop wedding, but along the way she gets drunk on antifreeze.

title: Lassie, I Mean Mother, Come Home
description: Gladys falls asleep and winds up on a truck bound for Mexico. When they discover she's missing, both Dave and Captain Manzini go into mourning.

title: Burned at the Steak
description: When his mother encourages him to meddle in their quarreling neighbors' affairs, Dave inexplicably winds up breaking up their marriage.

title: I'm Through Being a Nice Guy
description: Captain Manzini launches Operation Unscrupulous: he replicated the Porter, hires a trio of thieves to steal the original and establishes an airtight alibi for himself.

title: Lights, Camera, Mother
description: An obnoxious neighbor petitions Dave to get rid of his "eyesore" car, but he changes his tune when a television executive announces plans to feature the Porter in a TV commercial.

title: The Captain Manzini Grand Prix
description: Captain Manzini goads Dave into a race against a speed walker in an attempt to attain ownership of the Porter.

title: TV or Not TV
description: Dave puts a TV in the garage for his mother, but confusion abounds when she wins a chance to appear on a game show.

title: My Son, the Ventriloquist
description: With the help of his mother, Dave lands a new client by pretending to be a ventriloquist.

title: My Son, the Judge
description: Dave is up for a job as a judge, but complications ensue when he gets a pair of roller-skates stuck on his feet.

title: And Leave the Drive-In to Us
description: For his mother's birthday, Dave decides to take the family to the drive-in, but the evening is mostly a disaster.

title: For Whom the Horn Honks
description: In order to get his mits on the Porter, Captain Manzini fakes a terminal illness.

title: Hey Lady, Your Slip Isn't Showing
description: When Captain Manzini manipulates Barbara's mother, it results in the whole family treasure hunting for the Porter's registration slip.

title: Many Happy No-Returns
description: Dave and Barb each decide to forfeit their own Christmas presents to bid on the other's work in a charity art auction.

title: Shine On, Shine On, Honeymoon
description: Dave and Barb decide to finally go on their honeymoon, but Barb's mother goes to ridiculous lengths to ensure they don't leave.

title: I Remember Mama, Why Can't You Remember Me?
description: Dave's mother gets amnesia following a fender bender.

title: Goldporter
description: Captain Manzini uses a hypnotic drug on Dave to get him to agree to sell the Porter.

title: The Incredible Shrinking Car
description: Captain Manzini uses a molecular compressor on the Porter to render it useless to Dave.

title: I'd Rather Do It Myself, Mother
description: Dave hires a maid to help out with the housework, but she quickly takes charge of the house.

title: You Can't Get There from Here
description: The Crabtrees get stranded in the backwoods when the local sheriff discovers Dave's driver's license has expired.

title: A Riddler on the Roof
description: Dave and his mother try to thwart the assassination of a visiting dignitary.

title: My Son, the Criminal
description: A nosy mailman convinces officials that Dave killed his mother and buried her under the floor of the garage.

title: An Unreasonable Facsimile
description: Captain Manzini tries to steal the Porter away from the Crabtrees by hiring a Dave lookalike.

title: Over the Hill to the Junkyard
description: Numerous complications ensue when Barbara wins a new car.

title: It Might as Well Be Spring as Not
When You Wish Upon a Car
